intro: Trymalium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved trymalium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Trymalium parvifolium thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded woodlands.
